thread.title: Hurricane Imelda strengthens to Category 2 storm
thread.title_full: Hurricane Imelda strengthens to Category 2 storm

author: UPI Staff
title: Hurricane Imelda strengthens to Category 2 storm
text:
World
Hurricane Imelda strengthens to Category 2 storm
Oct. 1 (UPI) -- Hurricane Imelda strengthened to a Category 2 storm Wednesday as it closed in on Bermuda, the National Hurricane Center said.
The storm's eye was about 340 miles west-southwest of Bermuda, according to the 11 a.m. EDT update from the NHC, which said the British overseas territory should expect to experience hurricane-force winds from later Wednesday.
Forecasters said Imelda had maximum sustained winds of 100 mph and was moving east-northeast at a rapid 20 mph, though it is expected to speed up over the next few days.
"On the forecast track, the core of the hurricane will be near Bermuda this evening and tonight and move away from the island by Thursday afternoon," the NHC said.
A hurricane warning was in effect for Bermuda.
Forecasters warned the people of Bermuda to hurry and complete preparations to "protect life and property" before the storm arrives.
Imelda, the ninth named storm of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season, is expected to strengthen through Wednesday as it approaches Bermuda and could be a Category 2 storm by the time it nears the island.

This story was originally published October 1, 2025 at 12:46 AM.
